articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Israel and Iran's air war entered a second week on Friday and European officials sought to draw Tehran back to the negotiating table after President Donald Trump said any decision on potential U.S. involvement would be made within two weeks.
articles.title: Israel-Iran air war enters second week as Europe pushes diplomacy

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court let Donald Trump on Thursday retain control over California's National Guard while the state's Democratic governor proceeds with a lawsuit challenging the legality of the Republican president's use of the troops to quell protests and unrest in Los Angeles.
articles.title: US court lets Trump retain control of California National Guard for now

articles.author: Joe Cash, Liz Lee
articles.description: Central and southern China were on high alert for more flash floods on Friday as the annual East Asia monsoon gathered pace and extreme rainfall threatened disruption in the world's second-largest economy.
articles.title: China warns of more floods as extreme storms hit world's No.2 economy

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio met British foreign minister David Lammy on Thursday and held separate calls with Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong, French Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot and Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani to discuss the war between U.S. ally Israel and its regional rival Iran.
articles.title: US top diplomat Rubio discussed Israel-Iran war with key partners

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British lawmakers will vote on Friday on whether to proceed with a bill to legalise assisted dying for terminally ill people, in what would be the biggest social reform in the country for a generation.
articles.title: British lawmakers to vote on landmark assisted dying law

articles.author: Byron Kaye
articles.description: Some age-checking applications collect too much data and no product works 100% of the time, but using software to enforce a teenage social media ban can work in Australia, the head of the world's biggest trial of the technology said on Friday.
articles.title: Australia social media teen ban software trial organisers say the tech works

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ebrahim Hajjaj
articles.description: Like thousands of other Palestinians in Gaza, Hind Al-Nawajha takes a dangerous, miles-long journey every day to try to get some food for her family, hoping she makes it back alive.
articles.title: As death toll rises, Gazans make life-risking journeys to seek food

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine and Russia exchanged prisoners of war on Thursday, officials from both countries said, the latest round of swaps under an agreement struck in Istanbul.
articles.title: Ukraine and Russia exchange POWs in latest swap

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Malaysian court has granted jailed former Prime Minister Najib Razak a discharge not amounting to an acquittal in a 27 million ringgit ($6.4 million) money laundering case involving a former unit of scandal-tainted state fund 1MDB, state news agency Bernama reported on Friday.
articles.title: Malaysia drops 1MDB-related money laundering charges against ex-PM Najib, report says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A tram derailed and crashed into a pizzeria in southwestern Sweden late on Thursday, injuring several people, Swedish police said.
articles.title: Tram derails and crashes into pizzeria in Sweden, injuring several
